The Banner

The Banner element implementation needs to fill in the following requirements

  1. Switch between video and image based banner effortlessly
  2. Let the banner flow based on content or image and have height limitation as an option
  3. Flexibility with content positioning and sizing
  4. Ability to have a decorative element around the banner content
  5. Always have an option to apply a text container width | mainly for full width banners

1. Switch between video and image based banner effortlessly

The Problem

This condition implies that the banner backdrop can be an image or a video, both having the same positioning and resize strategy

Backdrop
Content

The Solution

Backdrop needs to be an individual an individual div tag with content inside. The inside element, be it video or image should have properties of: .banner__backdrop img, .banner__backdrop video {
  object-fit: cover;
  display: block;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
}

2. Let the banner flow based on content or image height

The Problem

The problem with fixed heights is that the banner does not have implicit dimmensions if elements are let to be in their natural web flow which most of the times is enough for such elements. On top of that, it does not need further developer intervention in implementation.

The Solution

To have this flexibility the banner needs to be implemented as a grid element rather than using the position absolute tehnique. Overlapping the content will be done using grid-area and z-index properties

.banner__content {
  grid-area: 1/1/-1/-1;
} .banner__backdrop {
  grid-area: 1/1/-1/-1;
  z-index: -1;
}

To optionally have a height limited to a fix number for specific needs the backdrop needs to have the following added properties where needed;

.banner__backdrop {
  grid-area: 1/1/-1/-1;
  z-index: -1;
  overflow: hidden;
  height: var(--banner-height, auto)
}

3. Flexibility with content positioning and sizing

The Problem

The banner should support basic flex alignment for its content: left/center/right/top/bottom

The Solution

Using justify-content / align-items / text-align CSS properties (classes with respective properties) on the CONTENT element which is set to flex

.banner__content {
  grid-area: 1/1/-1/-1;
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  text-align: left/center/right; //for block elements
  justify-content: flex-start/center/flex-end; //for inline-block/inline-flex elements
  align-items: flex-start/center/flex-end; //for inline-block/inline-flex elements
}

4. Ability to have a decorative element around the banner content

The Problem

The banner should support content styling as borders or backgrounds

The Solution

The content in the banner needs to have an extra div.banner__decor to apply the style

Backdrop
Content
Decor
.banner__decor {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  text-align: left/center/right; //alignment for block elements
  justify-content: flex-start/center/flex-end; //alignment for inline-block/inline-flex elements
  align-items: flex-start/center/flex-end; //alignment for inline-block/inline-flex elements
  border: 1px solid #000;
  max-width: 200px;
  background-color: lightgray;
}

5. Always have an option to apply a text container width | mainly for full width banners

The Problem

The banner text content should never be too long to read.

The Solution

Applying a width limitation on text content

.banner__decor {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  text-align: left/center/right; //alignment for block elements
  justify-content: flex-start/center/flex-end; //alignment for inline-block/inline-flex elements
  align-items: flex-start/center/flex-end; //alignment for inline-block/inline-flex elements
  max-width: 60rem;
  margin: 0 auto;
}
